column7: Introduction to basic dance techniques and stylistic work in the Musical Theater idiom for experienced dancers. Emphasis is on a physical and conceptual understanding of a variety of Musical Theater styles as related to America's own cultural diversity and the development of the specific skills necessary for performance and teaching. May be repeated in separate terms to a maximum of 2 hours. Prerequisite: Audition required. Primarily for Dance and Music Majors with a Concentration in Lyric Theater. Students with sufficient skills from other majors may be accepted with approval from instructor.
